fullscreen.title: Full Screen API
fullscreen.description: API for allowing content (like a video or canvas element) to take up the entire screen.
fullscreen.support: IE 11*, Firefox 10*, Chrome 15*, Safari 6*, Opera 15*, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22*, Chrome for Android 35*, Firefox for Android 30*

ambientlight.title: Ambient Light Events
ambientlight.description: Make a web page or an application aware of any change in the light intensity.

battery.title: Battery Status API
battery.description: Method to provide information about the battery status of the hosting device.

geolocation.title: Geolocation
geolocation.description: Method of informing a website of the user's geographical location
geolocation.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

pointerlock.title: Pointer Lock API
pointerlock.description: Provides input methods based on the movement of the mouse over time (i.e., deltas), not just the absolute position of the mouse cursor.

userproximity.title: Proximity API
userproximity.description: The proximity events are a handy way to know when a user is close to a device. These events make it possible to react to such a change, for example by shutting down the screen of a smartphone when the user is having a phone call with the device close to their ear.

devicemotion.title: Device Motion API
devicemotion.description: Fired when fresh data is available from an orientation sensor about the current orientation of the device as compared to the Earth coordinate frame.
devicemotion.support: Firefox 3.6, Chrome 7, Opera Mobile 12, Safari Mobile 4.2

deviceorientation.title: DeviceOrientation events
deviceorientation.description: API for detecting orientation and motion events from the device running the browser.
deviceorientation.support: IE 11, Firefox 4, Chrome 7, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

orientationchange.title: Screen Orientation API
orientationchange.description: Give the current orientation of the screen (landscape, portrait)
orientationchange.support: Firefox for Android, IE 11, Firefox Mobile ?

vibrate.title: Vibration API
vibrate.description: Method to access the vibration mechanism of the hosting device.
vibrate.support: Firefox 11*, Chrome 30, Opera 17, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

gamepads.title: Navigator.getGamepads
gamepads.description: Returns an array of Gamepad objects, one for each gamepad connected to the device.

donottrack.title: Navigator.donottrack
donottrack.description: Returns the user's do-not-track setting. This is 'yes' if the user has requested not to be tracked by web sites, content, or advertising.
donottrack.support: Chrome ?, Firefox 9, IE 9, Opera 12, Safari 5.1 (on OS X 10.7), Firefox Mobile 9

getusermedia.title: getUserMedia/Stream API
getusermedia.description: Method of accessing external device data (such as a webcam video stream). Formerly this was envisioned as the <device> element.
getusermedia.support: Firefox 17*, Chrome 21*, Opera 12, Blackberry Browser 10*, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30*

contextmenu.title: Toolbar/context menu
contextmenu.description: Method of defining a toolbar menu, a context menu or a list of (interactive) options using the <menu> element.

online.title: Navigator.onLine
online.description: Returns the online status of the browser.
online.support: Chrome ?, Firefox ?, IE 8*, Safari 5.0.4, Android Browser 2.2

onlineevents.title: Online/Offline events
onlineevents.description: Fired on the body-element of each page when the browser switches between online and offline mode.

eventsource.title: Server-sent DOM events
eventsource.description: Method of continuously sending data from a server to the browser, rather than repeatedly requesting it (EventSource interface, used to fall under HTML5)
eventsource.support: Firefox 6, Chrome 6, Safari 5, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

applicationcache.title: Offline web applications
applicationcache.description: Method of defining web page files to be cached using a cache manifest file, allowing them to work offline on subsequent visits to the page
applicationcache.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

rtcpeerconnection.title: WebRTC Peer-to-peer connections
rtcpeerconnection.description: Method of allowing two users to communicate directly, browser to browser using the RTCPeerConnection API.
rtcpeerconnection.support: Firefox 22*, Chrome 23*, Opera 18*, Opera Mobile 22*, Chrome for Android 35*, Firefox for Android 30*

notification.title: Web Notifications
notification.description: Method of alerting the user outside of a web page by displaying notifications (that do not require interaction by the user).
notification.support: Firefox 22, Chrome 5*, Safari 6, Android Browser 4.4*, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22*, Firefox for Android 30

postmessage.title: Cross-document messaging
postmessage.description: Method of sending information from a page on one domain to a page on a different one (using postMessage)
postmessage.support: IE 8, Firefox 3, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Opera Mini 5.0-7.0, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

websocket.title: Web Sockets
websocket.description: Bidirectional communication technology for web apps
websocket.support: IE 10, Firefox 4, Chrome 4, Safari 5, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

xhr2.title: XMLHttpRequest 2
xhr2.description: Adds more functionality to AJAX requests like file uploads, transfer progress information and the ability to send form data.
xhr2.support: IE 10, Firefox 4, Chrome 7, Safari 5, Opera 12, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

cors.title: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing
cors.description: Method of performing XMLHttpRequests across domains
cors.support: IE 8, Firefox 4, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 12, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

sendbeacon.title: navigator.sendBeacon
sendbeacon.description: Method can be used to asynchronously transfer small HTTP data from the User Agent to a web server.

blobconstructor.title: Blob constructing
blobconstructor.description: Construct Blobs (binary large objects) either using the BlobBuilder API (deprecated) or the Blob constructor.
blobconstructor.support: IE 10, Firefox 6*, Chrome 8*, Safari 6, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3*, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

dataset.title: dataset & data-* attributes
dataset.description: Method of applying and accessing custom data to elements.
dataset.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Opera Mini 5.0-7.0, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

filereader.title: FileReader API
filereader.description: Method of reading the contents of a File or Blob object into memory
filereader.support: IE 10, Firefox 4, Chrome 6, Safari 6, Opera 12, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

fileapi.title: File API
fileapi.description: Method of manipulating file objects in web applications client-side, as well as programmatically selecting them and accessing their data.
fileapi.support: IE 10, Firefox 4, Chrome 6, Safari 6, Opera 12, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

json.title: JSON parsing
json.description: Method of converting JavaScript objects to JSON strings and JSON back to objects using JSON.stringify() and JSON.parse()
json.support: IE 8, Firefox 4, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Opera Mini 5.0-7.0, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

namevaluestorage.title: Web Storage - name/value pairs
namevaluestorage.description: Method of storing data locally like cookies, but for larger amounts of data (sessionStorage and localStorage, used to fall under HTML5).
namevaluestorage.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

websqldatabase.title: Web SQL Database
websqldatabase.description: Method of storing data client-side, allows Sqlite database queries for access and manipulation
websqldatabase.support: Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35

indexeddb.title: IndexedDB
indexeddb.description: Method of storing data client-side, allows indexed database queries. Previously known as WebSimpleDB API.
indexeddb.support: IE 10, Firefox 4*, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

hashchange.title: Hashchange event
hashchange.description: Event triggered in JavaScript when the URL's hash has changed (for example: page.html#foo to page.html#bar)
hashchange.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

pagevisibility.title: Page Visibility
pagevisibility.description: JavaScript API for determining whether a document is visible on the display
pagevisibility.support: IE 10, Firefox 10*, Chrome 14*, Safari 7, Opera 15*, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 4.4*, Blackberry Browser 10*, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

touch.title: Touch events
touch.description: Method of registering when, where and how the interface is touched, for devices with a touch screen. These DOM events are similar to mousedown, mousemove, etc.
touch.support: IE 10, Firefox 4, Chrome 22, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

contenteditable.title: contenteditable attribute (basic support)
contenteditable.description: Method of making any HTML element editable
contenteditable.support: IE 6, Firefox 3, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

draganddrop.title: Drag and Drop
draganddrop.description: Method of easily dragging and dropping elements on a page, requiring minimal JavaScript.
draganddrop.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 9, Opera Mobile 10, IE Mobile 10

mutationobserver.title: Mutation Observer
mutationobserver.description: Method for observing and reacting to changes to the DOM. Replaces MutationEvents, which is deprecated.
mutationobserver.support: IE 9, Firefox 14, Chrome 18*, Safari 6*, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 4, Blackberry Browser 10*, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

treewalker.title: TreeWalker interface
treewalker.description: Represents the nodes of a document subtree and a position within them.
treewalker.support: Chrome 1, Firefox 2, IE 9, Opera 9, Safari 3, Android Browser ?, Firefox Mobile 1, IE Mobile ?, Opera Mobile 9, Safari Mobile 3

nodeiterator.title: NodeIterator interface
nodeiterator.description: Represents an iterator over the members of a list of the nodes in a subtree of the DOM. The nodes will be returned in document order.
nodeiterator.support: Chrome 1, Firefox 3.5, IE 9, Opera 9, Safari 3, Android Browser ?, Firefox Mobile 1, IE Mobile ?, Opera Mobile 9, Safari Mobile 3

range.title: Range interface
range.description: Represents a fragment of a document that can contain nodes and parts of text nodes in a given document
range.support: Range() constructor: Chrome ?, Firefox 24, Opera 15, Safari ?, Android Browser ?, Firefox Mobile 1, IE Mobile 9, Opera Mobile 9, Safari Mobile ?

matchmedia.title: matchMedia
matchmedia.description: API for finding out whether or not a media query applies to the document.
matchmedia.support: IE 10, Firefox 6, Chrome 9, Safari 6, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

webgl.title: WebGL - 3D Canvas graphics
webgl.description: Method of generating dynamic 3D graphics using JavaScript, accelerated through hardware
webgl.support: IE 6, Firefox 4, Chrome 8, Safari 6, Opera 12, iOS Safari 8, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 12, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

svg.title: SVG (basic support)
svg.description: Method of displaying basic Vector Graphics features using the embed or object elements. Refers to the SVG 1.1 spec.
svg.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Opera Mini 5.0-7.0, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

svgfilters.title: SVG filters
svgfilters.description: Method of using photoshop-like effects on SVG objects including blurring and color manipulation.
svgfilters.support: IE 10, Firefox 3, Chrome 5, Safari 6, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Opera Mini 5.0-7.0, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

webaudio.title: Web Audio API
webaudio.description: High-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio
webaudio.support: Firefox 25, Chrome 10*, Safari 6*, Opera 15*, iOS Safari 8*, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

speechsynthesis.title: Web Speech API
speechsynthesis.description: Method to provide speech input and text-to-speech output features in a web browser.
speechsynthesis.support: Chrome 25*, Safari 6.1*, Safari Mobile 7, Chrome for Android 33*

highresolutiontime.title: High Resolution Time API
highresolutiontime.description: Method to provide the current time in sub-millisecond resolution and such that it is not subject to system clock skew or adjustments. Called using performance.now()
highresolutiontime.support: IE 10, Firefox 15, Chrome 20*, Opera 15, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

navigationtiming.title: Navigation Timing API
navigationtiming.description: API for accessing timing information related to navigation and elements.
navigationtiming.support: IE 9, Firefox 7, Chrome 6*, Opera 15, Android Browser 4, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

usertiming.title: User Timing API
usertiming.description: Method to help web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.
usertiming.support: IE 10, Chrome 25, Opera 15, Android Browser 4.4, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, IE Mobile 10

requestanimationframe.title: requestAnimationFrame
requestanimationframe.description: API allowing a more efficient way of running script-based animation, compared to traditional methods using timeouts.
requestanimationframe.support: IE 10, Firefox 4*, Chrome 10*, Safari 6*, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 10*, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

worker.title: Web Workers
worker.description: Method of running scripts in the background, isolated from the web page
worker.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 2.1, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

sharedworker.title: Shared Web Workers
sharedworker.description: Method of allowing multiple scripts to communicate with a single web worker.
sharedworker.support: Firefox 29, Chrome 4, Safari 5, Opera 11, iOS Safari 5.0-5.1, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Firefox for Android 30

currentscript.title: document.currentScript
currentscript.description: Returns the script-element whose script is currently being processed.

elem-template.title: HTML templates
elem-template.description: Method of declaring a portion of reusable markup that is parsed but not rendered until cloned.
elem-template.support: Firefox 22, Chrome 26, Safari 8, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 4.4, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

elem-video.title: Video element
elem-video.description: Method of playing videos on webpages (without requiring a plug-in)
elem-video.support: IE 9, Firefox 4, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

elem-audio.title: Audio element
elem-audio.description: Method of playing sound on webpages (without requiring a plug-in)
elem-audio.support: IE 9, Firefox 4, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 11, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 11, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

elem-meter.title: Meter element
elem-meter.description: Represents either a scalar value within a known range or a fractional value.
elem-meter.support: Chrome 6, Firefox 16, Opera 11, Safari 5.2, Firefox Mobile 16, Opera Mobile 11

elem-progress.title: Progress element
elem-progress.description: Display the completion progress of a task, typically displayed as a progress bar.
elem-progress.support: Chrome 6, Firefox 6, Opera 11, IE 10, Safari 5.2, Android, Firefox Mobile 6, Opera Mobile 11

elem-picture.title: Picture element
elem-picture.description: An HTML extension for adaptive images

elem-output.title: Output element
elem-output.description: Represents the result of a calculation or user action.
elem-output.support: Chrome 10, Firefox 4, Opera 11, Safari nightly, Firefox Mobile 4

elem-datalist.title: Datalist element
elem-datalist.description: Method of setting a list of options for a user to select in a text field, while leaving the ability to enter a custom value.
elem-datalist.support: IE 6, Firefox 2, Chrome 4, Safari 4, Opera 9, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 10, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

elem-keygen.title: Keygen element
elem-keygen.description: Exists to facilitate generation of key material, and submission of the public key as part of an HTML form.
elem-keygen.support: Chrome 1, Firefox 1, Opera 3, Safari 1.2, Android 1.2, Firefox Mobile 1

elem-details.title: Details element
elem-details.description: Used as a disclosure widget from which the user can retrieve additional information.

attr-download.title: Download attribute
attr-download.description: When used on an anchor, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigate to it.
attr-download.support: Firefox 20, Chrome 14, Opera 15, Android Browser 4.4, Blackberry Browser 10, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30

attr-sandbox.title: sandbox attribute for iframes
attr-sandbox.description: Method of running external site pages with reduced privileges (e.g. no JavaScript) in iframes
attr-sandbox.support: IE 10, Firefox 17, Chrome 4, Safari 5, Opera 15, iOS Safari 8, Android Browser 3, Blackberry Browser 7, Opera Mobile 22, Chrome for Android 35, Firefox for Android 30, IE Mobile 10

attr-input-pattern.title: pattern attribute for input elements
attr-input-pattern.description: A regular expression that the control's value is checked against.
attr-input-pattern.support: Chrome 5, Firefox 4, IE 10, Opera 9.6, Firefox Mobile 4, Opera Mobile

ES5.title: Supports ECMAScript 5
ES5.description: True, if supports Strict Mode and bind() method.

ES3.title: Supports only ECMAScript 3
ES3.description: Means: not fully supported ECMAScript 5. True, if not supports Strict Mode (e.g IE9) and bind() method (e.g. Safari 5.1)

SLOWCONNECTION.title: Is slow connection
SLOWCONNECTION.description: Network connection feature detection referenced from Modernizr - Copyright (c) Faruk Ates, Paul Irish, Alex Sexton
SLOWCONNECTION.support: Firefox 12, Firefox Mobile 12, Android Browser 2.2, Firefox OS 1.5
